content.question: Which of the following best explains the response of the Russian government to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) requirements as argued in the passage?

choices.label: The Russian government refused to follow the IMF requirement for very gradual liberalization reforms.
The Russian government requested the European Union to assist with the economic liberalization process.
The Russian government aligned its views with the IMF, which made the economic liberalization process more expedient.
The Russian government, under the advice of the IMF, rapidly raised rents, which caused protests in Moscow in other major cities.

content.answer: The Russian government aligned its views with the IMF, which made the economic liberalization process more expedient.
